metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27844 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in openjpeg's src/lib/openjp2/t2.c in versions prior to 2.4.0. This flaw allows an attacker to provide crafted input to openjpeg during conversion and encoding, causing an out-of-bounds write. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

notes.Note: ebarretto> The fix for this CVE was not applied in 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u6 even though it was mentioned in the changelog and the patch is also in debian/patches/ ccdm94> the vulnerable code was introduced by commit 4edb8c8337, which was applied to be a part of version 2.4.0 of openjpeg.

criterions.comment: insighttoolkit4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
openjpeg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was not-affected').
